stories.text:
I'm a recent-lurker-and-signee; with the negativity and doom-scrolling that's so pervasive in our modern discourse, I'd like to kick off this thread on a positive note!

Moreover, recent signees might benefit from seeing discussions about the UX of HN for a couple of reasons. It would help spread knowledge about the features that come with familiarity, and provide some explicit notions of reasonable UX design for new UX designers.

*What do you like about HN?*

I'm a fan of HN's user-centric design. I really appreciate the favorites feature in particular, specifically about how favoriting a thread brings you to your favorites. It's a very functional bookmark system.

*What would you like to see improved?*

There are only two features I wish HN had: a way to remove the karma counts, and some method to receive notice about replies to comments/submissions. I'm sure there's a way to cobble it together, given the user-centric design; there's probably a way to cobble these features together, it would just be nice to have natively.

Wishing everyone and your loved ones the best! Hope y'all are having a good day, and stay safe :)
stories.title: Ask HN: Meta: HN Commentary

stories.text:
Google tries to figure out what you might mean and then return appropriate results, but sometimes I want an exact search. Even putting quotation marks around the phrase doesn't work reliably.

The same is largely true of DDG as well.

So ... what do you use when you want to do an "exact search" on the web?
stories.title: Ask HN: Is there a search engine that performs “Exact Search”?
